etymology.interpretation: The character 勹(bāo, "wrap") illustrates a person bending over, signifying an action of encircling or enclosing, which aligns well with meanings related to wrapping or containing.

examples.chinese: 妈妈用柔软的布包住易碎品(媽媽用柔軟的布包住易碎品)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā yòng róuruǎn de bù bāo zhù yì suìpǐn.
examples.english: Mother wraps fragile items with soft cloth.

examples.chinese: 他熟练地把礼物包成漂亮的形状(他熟練地把禮物包成漂亮的形狀)，让人感受到温情(讓人感受到溫情)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shúliàn de bǎ lǐwù bāo chéng piàoliang de xíngzhuàng, ràng rén gǎnshòu dào wēnqíng.
examples.english: He skillfully wraps the gift into a beautiful shape, letting people feel warmth.
